title: Filter bar in Merge Request Analytics is case sensitive
description:
When typing search queries into the filter bar, the query fails if the user does not use the exact same capitalization than the label. Even worse, the UI makes it look like the filter bar actually recognizes the label the user meant and displays it with correct capitalization and color, leaving no way for the user to recognize the problem. 

![MR_Analytics_filter](/uploads/af46decbb59a90b0c09dcebd34ae430d/MR_Analytics_filter.mp4)

I experienced this myself first hand and was blocked by this for multiple days without knowing what's wrong because our entire UI makes it look like everything is going as expected, just the results are not showing up, I had just expected we were having trouble with the number of merge requests, so I'm assigning this one ~"severity::1" based on our [severity table](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/quality/issue-triage/#severity) as it most closely aligns with the following statement:

> "I can't figure this out." Users are blocked (or so confused that they believe they are blocked), and are likely to ask for support.

title: CI/CD Analytics: Add VSA deployment tiles to deployment frequency tab
description:
<!-- This issue template can be used a great starting point for feature requests. The last section "Release notes" can be used as a summary of the feature and is also required if you want to have your release post blog MR auto generated using the release post item generator:  https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/blog/release-posts/#release-post-item-generator. The remaining sections are the backbone for every feature in GitLab. -->

### Release notes 

<!-- What is the problem and solution you're proposing? This content sets the overall vision for the feature and serves as the release notes that will populate in various places, including the [release post blog](https://about.gitlab.com/releases/categories/releases/) and [Gitlab project releases](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/releases). " -->

### Problem to solve 

<!-- What is the user problem you are trying to solve with this issue? -->

Deployment frequency appears in two different locations under value stream analytics and under [CI/CD Analytics](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/analytics/ci_cd_analytics.html) - they are both using the same API

![image](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/0056f5d3057a95e1a69410186fe5d562/image.png)

![image](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/32fdc5a2355af050c8de824cc8d45dcb/image.png)



### Proposal 

<!-- Use this section to explain the feature and how it will work. It can be helpful to add technical details, design proposals, and links to related epics or issues. -->


In [CI/CD Analytics](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/analytics/ci_cd_analytics.html), it would be nice to add the deployment frequency and number of deployments tiles to the deployment frequency tab, like this:

![image](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/504b8dcd3cf7dd9ecfc886b022092f49/image.png)

Things to note:

- A license check should be performed (for Ultimate) if using the VSA API, so it would be better to use the DORA API because that is already restricted to Ultimate.
- The tiles should represent the same interval that is displayed on the CI/CD Analytics page.
- CI/CD Analytics shows only deployment to production environments - deployment frequency in VSA shows?

title: HTTP code not fast enough to get all responses
description:
### Problem

During testing of the runner integration it was found that a race condition exists for reading data from a network socket when the server will close the connection. The current code reads bytes as the response is parsed, this causes a problem where responses may not be fully read before the socket is closed and the data goes away.

### Proposal

Use the new high performance Pipeline IO classes and separate out reading the data from the socket from the HTTP parsing code. Each CustomBinaryReaderPipeline will end up with a dedicated reader task that buffers the incoming socket data and separate parsing code.

1. [x] Write a new `CustomBinaryReaderPipeline`
1. [x] Create tests to verify the contract is similar to legacy version
1. [x] Verify all tests are passing

title: Create a new HttpMessageService for each IWebMachine instance
description:
The HttpMessageService is currently used as a singleton. Instead it should be one instance per IWebMachine (one per scan).

1. [x] Move HttpMessageService into PeachWeb
1. [x] Setup dependency injection such that each IWebMachine instance gets it's own instance of HttpMessageService
1. [x] Move tests into PeachWeb tests project

title: Add logging and to HttpConnectionPool code around exceptions being caught
description:
The http connection pooling code isn't logging exceptions that are occurring.
Lack of logging could impact debugging future issues in the code.

## Proposal

Dependency inject ILoggingFactory to allow non-dependency injected instances the ability to create loggers
to log when certain exceptions our occurring.

1. [x] Inject ILoggingFactory into HttpMessageService
1. [x] Pass to HttpConnectionPoolService, HttpConnectionPool, Http11Connection
1. [x] In HttpConnectionPool--
   1. Add LogInfo's to try/catch block in Send method

title: Http11Connection should check for 'connection' header equals 'close'
description:
The Http11Connection assumes keepalive (we add it as a header), but the server could response with `Connection: close`.
The impact is we might need to retry the next `send` operation, but it shouldn't have other side effects in the system.

### Proposal

Check for this header value and mark connection to be closed.

Tasks:

1. [x] Update code
1. [x] Create a test to validate

title: LegacyDiffNote st_diff being set incorrectly some of the time
description:
From https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/343345#note_710950301

We want to directly address the issue where `st_diff` is sometimes correct on `GitHub->GitLab->GitLab` imports and sometimes it is not.

It seems like it is somehow related to the `merger_request_diff_files` perhaps not being set correctly somehow on export from GitLab and then not correctly imported.

## Reproduce

1. Import [Nodejs repo from GitHub](https://github.com/nodejs)
1. Look at the Diff notes for merge request `40009`, specifically the one with a `line_code = 59863e22002f8881745543fff366759cb74364cc_374_374`
1. Export that project and then import file based again and look at the same `note` from merge request `40009`
   - you can delete the `issues.ndjson` file and keep only the last `1000` lines from the `merge_requests.ndjson` to make it go faster.

From my investigations the note from the original import(`note` below) and the one from the export/import(`bad_note` below) seem to have mistmatching `merge_requests_diff_files` info(which is where the data below is eventually parsed from)

#### Notes...

```console
current note diff files...

irb(main):015:0> note.diff_file.diff_lines.map(&:line_code)
=> [nil, "59863e22002f8881745543fff366759cb74364cc_371_371", "59863e22002f8881745543fff366759cb74364cc_372_372", "59863e22002f8881745543fff366759cb74364cc_373_373", "59863e22002f8881745543fff366759cb74364cc_374_374"]

last one matches

irb(main):016:0> note.line_code

st_diff to diff file, then that is used to lookup - many from the bad_note...when running the same and I don't know why

"59863e22002f8881745543fff366759cb74364cc_234_327", "59863e22002f8881745543fff366759cb74364cc_235_328", nil, "59863e22002f8881745543fff366759cb74364cc_1977_2070


irb(main):132:0> note.diff_file.diff_lines.size
=> 5
has the line_code in the diff_lines we need
irb(main):133:0> bad_note.diff_file.diff_lines.size
=> 150
does not have the line we need...

=> "59863e22002f8881745543fff366759cb74364cc_374_374"

2 version of raw_diffs for fs.md file on good note...one on bad note - did it export the wrong one somehow???

irb(main):146:0> note.noteable.merge_request_diff.raw_diffs.size
=> 4
irb(main):147:0> bad_note.noteable.merge_request_diff.raw_diffs.size
=> 3
irb(main):148:0> bad_note.noteable.merge_request_diff.raw_diffs.map(&:new_path)
=> ["doc/api/fs.md", "lib/internal/fs/promises.js", "test/parallel/test-fs-promises-file-handle-stream.js"]
irb(main):149:0> note.noteable.merge_request_diff.raw_diffs.map(&:new_path)
=> ["doc/api/fs.md", "doc/api/fs.md", "lib/internal/fs/promises.js", "test/parallel/test-fs-promises-file-handle-stream.js"]
irb(main):150:0> note.noteable.merge_request_diff.merge_request_diff_files.size
=> 3
```

- path to look at for variance in exact case...
   - http://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/c56b1af721280e02910e9f5857b12b1a01c0f1c8/lib/gitlab/github_import/importer/pull_request_importer.rb#L72-72 -> http://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/c56b1af721280e02910e9f5857b12b1a01c0f1c8/lib/gitlab/import/merge_request_helpers.rb#L62-62 -> http://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/c56b1af721280e02910e9f5857b12b1a01c0f1c8/app/models/merge_request_diff.rb#L208-208

Related to #343345.

title: GitLab Migration - NoMethodError undefined method `start_with?' for nil:NilClass
description:

title: Report Widgets Core: Support polling/real-time
description:
# Summary

This is part of the epic: https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/6647.

Some merge request widget extensions utilize polling to wait while the backend generates the related report. We should consider how the core component can enable extensions to easily implement this polling.

epic.title: [MR Widget Eng] Update core MR Widget extension component to fully support the design guidelines

title: SaaS Service Ping Metrics Failures causing null UMAU value
description:
## Summary

In multiple recent runs of manual SaaS Service Ping, metrics failures have caused UMAU to be null for our SaaS customer base. This is a significantly important metric for the business and the failure should be treated as a ~"priority::1" ~"severity::1" issue.

## Details

From @cbraza 

>It looks like the UMAU metric (usage_activity_by_stage_monthly.manage.events) also timed out (or wasnt correctly recorded) in the pings on 2021-09-16, 2021-09-23, 2021-10-08 , and 2021-10-18 . It was successful on the 2021-10-14 ping

>For those pings, Im seeing -1 for usage_activity_by_stage_monthly.manage.events

Query to view the data
``` sql
SELECT 
  ping_created_at,
  raw_usage_data_payload,
  raw_usage_data_payload['usage_activity_by_stage_monthly']['manage'] AS usage_by_stage_manage_payload,
  raw_usage_data_payload['usage_activity_by_stage_monthly']['manage']['events'] AS manage_events_umau_metric,
  umau_value
FROM common.fct_usage_ping_payload
WHERE usage_ping_delivery_type = 'SaaS'
  AND ping_created_at BETWEEN '2021-08-01' AND CURRENT_DATE
--  AND dim_usage_ping_id  IN ( --if you want to limit to _just_ the pings used for xMAU reporting
--                             '34561735' --September SaaS ping used in xMAU reporting
--                             , '33892790' --August SaaS ping used in xMAU reporting
--                             )
ORDER BY 1
;
```

title: Complete support for footnotes in the Content Editor
description:
## Problem to solve

In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/71067/#what-does-this-mr-do-and-why we introduced the ability to render Markdown footnotes in the Content Editor. However, because of a [limitation in the backend Markdown renderer](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/343365), we are unable to preserve the footnote ID. 

Once https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/343365 is resolved, however, we should be able to complete support for footnotes in the Content Editor. 

## Proposal

After https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/61792 is merged, revisit the rendering of the footnotes to include the missing metadata and preserve the users' preferences.

epic.title: GitLab Flavored Markdown extensions for Content Editor

title: [integration] Edit the title of a Task
description:
This is the integration issue for the work-items title widget, including the GraphQL query and any mutations needed. Related to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/334808, which will have the schema mocked. When the schema is determined, move the definition to this issue.

### Schema

See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/work_items/graphql/typedefs.graphql#L40 for definition.

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Title updates in real-time
- [ ] Redis counter
- [ ] Snowplow event tracker (documentation TBD)

### Redis Counters

- **name:** `users_updating_work_item_title` 
- **category:** `work_items`
- **redis_slot:** `users` 
- **include in the following aggregation counters:**
  - [x] `xmau_plan`
  - [X] `xmau_project_management`
  - [ ] `xmau_product_planning`
  - [ ] `xmau_certify`
  - [X] `users_work_items`
- **documentation:** [Service Ping Implementation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/service_ping/implement.html), [Redis HLL Counters](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/service_ping/implement.html#redis-hll-counters), [Plan's Redis HLL Schema / Approach](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/346046)

title: LegacyDiffNotes have st_diff incorrectly on GitLab import
description:
## During GitLab to GitLab Import(file based)

* The `LegacyDiffNote` is a relation that comes from the `merge_requests.ndjson` file which means it [invokes this save action](http://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/0816e4664224c86a9c3868127ad890d7cf0526c6/lib/gitlab/import_export/relation_tree_restorer.rb#L83-83), which causes it to hit the [before_create callback](http://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/0816e4664224c86a9c3868127ad890d7cf0526c6/app/models/legacy_diff_note.rb#L16-16), which overwrites the `st_diff` value from the `merge_requests.ndjson` file.
* This then causes the [st_diff to get set](http://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/0816e4664224c86a9c3868127ad890d7cf0526c6/app/models/legacy_diff_note.rb#L91-91) from the [raw_diffs](http://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/0816e4664224c86a9c3868127ad890d7cf0526c6/app/models/legacy_diff_note.rb#L80-80) that is ultimately pulled from the merge request diff files...

The fact that this doesn't work correctly sometimes(wrong `st_diff` is set) is concerning...

More details - https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/343345#note_710950301

### Plan

However - We can fix this for those times it doesn't and overall

* We could simply try skipping [the before_create callback](http://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/0816e4664224c86a9c3868127ad890d7cf0526c6/app/models/legacy_diff_note.rb#L16-16) on `LegacyDiffNote` when importing through `GitLab` file based import since the `merge_requests.ndjson` file will have `st_diff` populated already, and see if that works.
  * We'll merely check for presence on `st_diff` and put this functionality behind an operational feature flag

Related to #343345.

title: CI/CD Analytics: Tabs not visible to admin
description:
## Problem to solve

> When I access CI/CD analytics as a user, I see tabs. When I access the same page as admin, theres no tabs for deployment frequency/lead time.

-- [@lyle in Slack#is-this-known on 2021-10-20](https://gitlab.slack.com/archives/CETG54GQ0/p1634764381302100?thread_ts=1634764381302100&cid=CETG54GQ0).

## Proposal

In CI/CD Analytics, all tabs visible to non-admin users should also be visible to admin users.

title: Migrate GKE cluster creation to use the Agent
description:
<!--

* Use this issue template for suggesting new docs or updates to existing docs.
  Note: Doc work as part of feature development is covered in the Feature Request template.

* For issues related to features of the docs.gitlab.com site, see
     https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-docs/issues/

* For information about documentation content and process, see
     https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/ -->

### Problem to solve

It came to my knowledge that [the new method to create a cluster from GitLab using IaC](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/infrastructure/clusters/connect/new_gke_cluster.html) connects the cluster through cluster certificates, not through the Agent. We need to fix this in the docs and in the example project.

Once done, we can add this to the docs's nav. (https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-docs/-/merge_requests/2211#note_711782156)

We're adding a deprecation notice here too (https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/76614). When done, we'll need to remove it.

### Who can address the issue

~"group::configure" 

### Proposal

Re-use the Agent connection approach from https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/343229+

### Other links/references

https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/configure/-/epics/8#note_711341115

title: Improve browser Total Blocking Time (TBT) performance of View File (source) page into S3 tier
description:
The View File (source) page's Total Blocking Time (TBT) results have been significantly improved in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/328221. This issue is a follow up to improve browser performance results further: 

```
* Environment:                10k
* Environment Version:        14.5.0-pre `438c3b27dbe`
* Date:                       2021-10-22
NAME                       | FCP (ms) | LCP (ms)       | TBT (ms)        | SI (ms) | LVC (ms) | TFR SIZE (kb) | SCORE | RESULT
---------------------------|----------|----------------|-----------------|---------|----------|---------------|-------|-------
web_project_file_source    | 792      |  4756 (<7000) |  4356 (<5500)  | 994     | 4767     | 1437.6        | 72    | Passed
```

[The View File (source) page being tested can be seen here on Staging](https://staging.gitlab.com/gpt/large_projects/gitlabhq1/blob/master/fixtures/emojis/index.json). This page is specifically one loading in a large source file. Below is the screenshot of page's [historical test results](http://10k.testbed.gitlab.net/-/grafana/d/jH6yoWVMz/gitlab-performance-sitespeed-results?orgId=1&from=now-14d&to=now&var-test_name=web_project_file_source)

![Screenshot_2021-10-22_at_14.36.40](/uploads/cf787f6d6525c3bed96d5e2e9279ace6/Screenshot_2021-10-22_at_14.36.40.png)


### Test Details

Testing was done on our [10k Reference Architecture](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/administration/reference_architectures/10k_users.html) environment with [our lab condition SiteSpeed pipeline](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/quality/performance-sitespeed) (named GitLab Browser Performance Tool internally). The project being tested is a copy of [gitlabhq](https://staging.gitlab.com/gpt/large_projects/gitlabhq1/) (tarball can be found [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/quality/performance-data/-/blob/master/projects_export/gitlabhq_export_13.0.0.tar.gz)). GitLab Browser Performance Tool tests information is listed at [Current test details](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/quality/performance-sitespeed/-/wikis/Current-Test-Details) page.

The latest GitLab Browser Performance pipeline results can always be found [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/quality/performance/-/wikis/Benchmarks/SiteSpeed/10k). Through this page the full SiteSpeed report can be found via the `SiteSpeed Report` link on that page.

As per our [performance targets](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/quality/issue-triage/#severity) this page's TBT metrics is below the target of 9000 ms which is ~"severity::2" . Task is to improve the page's browser performance into S3 tier.

title: Web IDE: in the project tree, show full file name in a tooltip on :hover
description:
When hovering over a file name in the project tree in Web IDE, we do not show any tooltip with the full file's name. This leads to a situation when we might make the file name even less readable due to adding the cropping the title even more to accommodate the "more" button

| Current behavior | With a standard title tooltip |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![Screenshot_2021-10-22_at_12.06.08](/uploads/dbc88af3ad5103c65641132cad3fa903/Screenshot_2021-10-22_at_12.06.08.png) | ![Screenshot_2021-10-22_at_12.02.42](/uploads/61d4b1580cb5a328647e693abaa2a648/Screenshot_2021-10-22_at_12.02.42.png) |

Once can "expand" the left panel with the file tree to see all the files, of course, but it's not always viable as it "eats up" the actual editor's space. Sometimes we just want to make sure we're interacting with the correct file with minimum actions required.

![Screenshot_2021-10-22_at_12.11.08](/uploads/84ee61cdb56551bf6be318b69106a80f/Screenshot_2021-10-22_at_12.11.08.png)

## Suggestion

Let's show the file name for the files on hover. Keep in mind that showing it with [a tooltip UI component](https://gitlab-org.gitlab.io/gitlab-ui/?path=/story/base-tooltip--top-default) might be very expensive performance-wise if we set it to every item. I would suggest we either:

  1. simply use the standard `title` attribute on `.file-row-name`, OR
  1. introduce _only one_ `gl-tooltip` that we smartly re-use for any hovered file

It is suggested to accept option 1 as an MVC and then, iteratively research and implement option 2.
